title: THE MATRIX
legend: So, blue pill or red pill?
description: The Matrix is a groundbreaking science-fiction film directed by the Wachowski brothers, released in 1999. This iconic film marked a milestone in cinema history for its complex plot, groundbreaking visual effects and profound philosophical themes. Beyond its immediate impact, The Matrix continues to provoke debate and diverse interpretations on subjects such as virtual reality, technology, social control and the quest for truth.

title: SPICE GIRLS
legend: I wanna really wanna zig-a-zig ah!
description: The Spice Girls are a British musical group formed in London in 1994. Comprising five members - Melanie Brown (nicknamed Scary Spice), Melanie Chisholm (Sporty Spice), Emma Bunton (Baby Spice), Geri Halliwell (Ginger Spice) and Victoria Beckham (Posh Spice) - the group became one of the most striking pop phenomena of the 1990s. They have also been acclaimed for their message of female empowerment and individuality, embodying the Girl Power ideals that have inspired generations of young girls around the world.

title: TAMAGOTCHI
description: Tamagotchis are virtual electronic toys created by the Japanese company Bandai. First launched in 1996, they quickly became a worldwide phenomenon, particularly among children and teenagers. Although their popularity has waned over time, Tamagotchis remain a pop culture icon of the 1990s and continue to have a devoted fan base around the world.

title: POKÉMON
description: Pokémon is a media franchise developed by Nintendo, Game Freak and Creatures Inc. The Pokémon franchise has become one of the world's most popular and profitable entertainment franchises, encompassing a wide range of media, including video games, TV series, movies, trading card games, toys and much more. Today, the Game Boy Pokémon games continue to be revered by nostalgic gamers and are considered timeless classics of video game history.

title: FLIP PHONES
description: Flip phones, also known as clamshell phones, have been an icon of mobile technology for many years. They made their debut in the 1990s and quickly gained popularity due to their compact design and practicality. Flip phones reached their peak of popularity in the 2000s, with iconic models such as the Motorola Razr and the Nokia 2720. They were often associated with a sense of sophistication and style and were frequently used as fashion accessories.

title: WORLD CUP 98
description: In 1998, France hosted the FIFA World Cup, culminating in a historic final where the host nation, France triumphed over Brazil with a 3-0 victory, thanks to Zinedine Zidane's unforgettable headers and Emmanuel Petit's closing goal. This win awarded France their first World Cup title, uniting the country in celebration. The tournament stood out for introducing the golden goal rule in knockout stages and expanding the competition to 32 teams, enhancing the intensity of the matches.

title: FRIENDS
legend: They don't know that we know they know we know
description: Friends is an American television sitcom created by David Crane and Marta Kauffman. The show revolves around a group of six friends living in Manhattan: Ross Geller, Rachel Green, Monica Geller, Chandler Bing, Joey Tribbiani, and Phoebe Buffay. Even after its conclusion, Friends remains a cultural phenomenon, with a dedicated fanbase and continued popularity through reruns and streaming platforms. Its timeless humor and relatable characters continue to resonate with audiences around the world, cementing its status as a classic sitcom.
